User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:2.0b12pre) Gecko/20110202 Firefox/4.0b12pre
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:2.0b10pre) Gecko/20110114 Thunderbird/3.3a2

Selection of a size number over 9 is without efffect, the three-dotted default display remains unchanged

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open Edit > Preferences
2. Choose the Display panel > Formatting tab
3. click the Size dropdown menu
4. Choose size like 14 or over
5. the 3 dotted placeholder remains unchanged
Actual Results:  
No size change seems to be selected

Expected Results:  
The chosen size number should appear and be validated on

- there is no such problem for me on Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; fr-FR; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101207 Thunderbird/3.1.7

- same problem of dropdown size selection in the Fonts and Encoding dialog triggered with Advanced button.

- when you chose a single digit number, it works, when you chose a double digit one, it fails. So obviously this menu needs a bit more space.
